pullrequest.title: Move FindODE.cmake to ign-cmake from ign-physics

content.raw:
There wouldn't be any complaint from cmake, because it would just treat `ODE_LIBRARY` as an empty variable. In my opinion, this is one of cmake's most glaring flaws, but I also understand the design motivation behind it.

One way to sidestep that issue would be to keep the `ODE_LIBRARY` variable and just also create an `ODE_LIBRARIES` variable which is equivalent, but I would discourage that practice, especially since this find-module is only intended for internal use.

Even if we were to keep `ODE_LIBRARY` as an option, we should still replace its use in `ign-physics` with the imported target `ODE::ODE`. We don't actually want to use that variable (or the `ODE_LIBRARIES` variable) at all outside of this find-module, because we should always link to the imported target, which will be named `ODE::ODE`.
